sect1.title: SUM

row.entry: The set of records to process. This may be the name of a dataset or a record set derived from some filter condition, or any expression that results in a derived record set. This also may be the keyword GROUP to indicate finding the sum of values of the field in a group, when used in a RECORD structure to generate crosstab statistics.
Optional. A logical expression indicating which records to include in the sum. Valid only when the recordset parameter is the keyword GROUP to indicate the elements in a group.
Optional. Specifies the activity is part of an index read operation, which allows the optimizer to generate optimal code for the operation.
A comma-delimited list of expressions to find the sum of. This may also be a SET of values.

sect1.para: The SUM function returns the additive sum of the value in each record of the recordset or valuelist.
sect1.programlisting:
MySum := SUM(Person,Person.Salary); // total all salaries
SumVal2 := SUM(4,8,16,2,1); //returns 31 SetVals := [4,8,16,2,1]; SumVal3 := SUM(SetVals); //returns 31
sect1.para: See Also: COUNT, AVE, MIN, MAX
